content: I figured I’d create a thread. Wanted to ask how many of these DTKs we have, and whether the access is just plain ssh login or something along those lines.
I guess we could also enable VNC
The question isn’t so much can we as should we
And I think we do have to; sometimes a quarantine alert only shows up as a GUI popup
At least that’s what Andre said, I’ve only experienced it when requiring access to run the debugger.
Which is also a useful ability, to be clear
Wouldn’t you also need GUI access to do any kind of updates for XCode or the SDK?
That is not a thing that an arbitrary user of this shared infra machine should be doing.
But when I downloaded the Xcode beta, it was just a disk image with Xcode in it. I hope that you could do that without admin or GUI access
Well if you need to launch XCode or its tools there are updates where it will often require you to update it before it will let you continue in my experience.
A good point. Then it might just be some infra/ admin has to do that. An unfortunate aspect of shared systems
I mean if someone actually needs it I'm open to enabling VNC access

I don’t know the original source of this thread but as I understand access to a DTK requires signing an NDA on discussing the hardware (I haven’t signed one).

If someone has signed that they could be held responsible if something goes wrong in the worst case. With that in mind I would think we’d want to give access to a trusted few who can probably also be trusted with admin/GUI privileges on the machine.
@XAMPPRocky so, we're going to grant access to members of the compiler team, the libs team and the compiler-contributors team
re: nda, we haven't signed one, the dtk is provided by macstadium and there wasn't an nda in their tos
(still, if apple doesn't want people discussing perf let's not)
